website_summaries.verdict: Narrow profile and a unique design make this fan stand out among the competition.
pros: Full articulation and oscillation without the extra space loss
Great deal of automation such as an automatic timer shutoff
Narrow profile with vertical height covers more of the body when sitting on a desk
cons: Caution is required to prevent tipping over

customer_reviews.title: After waiting on hold for a few minutes the lady comes back and tells me it’s not under manufactures warranty and there’s no par
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this product! It is not made by Honeywell. It is made by KAZ USA. I bought it December 1 st 2017 and it fell over and the blade broke off!! After waiting on hold for a few minutes the lady comes back and tells me it’s not under manufactures warranty and there’s no parts that they offer for replacement so basically it’s garbage. What happened to customer service?
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Jaime

customer_reviews.title: It's an 80MM computer fan in a fancy case!
customer_reviews.text: It's an 80mm computer fan in a fancy case! It works but really??? Come on Honeywell! you make some awesome fans but this? Seriously though you pay for about $3 worth of electronics and the rest is in the case. This is NOT worth the $$ they charge for it. I bought it because I've had good luck with the brand but this is just crap! the fan occupies approx 1/3 of the vent space and the rest is for show. It's going back, that's just bull.
customer_reviews.author: TheOriginalgiga

customer_reviews.title: A great fan if you don't want your fan to actually move any air.
customer_reviews.text: For the price of the fan and its size, this thing has such a narrow window of air movement that I can't believe it's a deliberate design. The tower is 13" tall, but only blows air across a 2.5 inch hole. With the fan sitting on my desk, about a foot to my left, I get blowing air on my shoulder. That's it. Also, for a fan billed as a QuietSet, it's just as loud as cheaper desktop fans I've had in the past. At least those fans moved more air. Incredibly disappointing, because I own a couple of Honeywell's large tower fans and they work wonderfully well.
customer_reviews.author: Crystal

customer_reviews.title: Honeywell has a different definition of Quiet then we do.....
customer_reviews.text: On the "Quiet" mode... it's not... then on "White Noise," yes, there's noise.... I have a 6 inch fan that's MUCH quieter then this one.
customer_reviews.author: Harry

customer_reviews.title: Huge grill, tiny fan, bright lights
customer_reviews.text: Deceptively advertised as a tower fan, this has a tiny circular fan in the middle of the tower. Tiny amount of air is blown. Also the lights are ridiculously bright blue LED's, I wrapped the base in a cloth to use it on my bedside table while I sleep. Due to the tiny fan, I have to tilt the device to point it at my face. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Damion Gomez

customer_reviews.title: A great desk fan!
customer_reviews.text: Love this fan. Borrowed it from a coworker. Loved it so much brought my own. Very quiet. I love the oscalating option. Very cool air. I would definitely recommend. I love the sleek design and timer option.
customer_reviews.author: JennieHobbs

customer_reviews.title: Not actually a tower fan. Just a small circle fan.
customer_reviews.text: Totally works as advertised and does it’s just well. But I feel there’s a bit of false advertising here because it’s definitely NOT a tower fan. Just a small round fan in a tower shape. The bottom 20% and top 20% are sealed off and just LOOK part of a tower fan.
customer_reviews.author: M. McIvor

customer_reviews.title: It's a computer fan in a tower. And it's not any quieter.
customer_reviews.text: It's just a computer fan in a tower style housing. They could have saved much more space on design and I could have saved money if I knew this is what I would get. It's not any quieter than any other small fan I have had.
customer_reviews.author: Nick D.

customer_reviews.title: 80mm case fan - Misleading Picture and Description - NOT A TOWER FAN
customer_reviews.text: This is the epitome of <expletive removed> design. This is NOT at all like the tower-style QuietSet fans, which have an awesome spinning cylinder fan inside, are truly quiet, and move a lot of air. It's just a crappy, loud, and weak, 80mm computer fan wedged inside a tall cylinder case. Most of the case is blocked off. It's the most deceptive thing I've ever seen in my life. SHAME ON YOU HONEYWELL. I'm sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Rosangela Canino Koning

customer_reviews.title: Definitely one to purchase!!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a bedside night time/ relieving hot flashes fan. It is awesome! It has several settings including the Sleep Mode which is quiet and gentle. It rotates just enough for a nice air flow. Really a great little fan. I’m going to buy one for my guest room too! The timer feature is a great way to cool off until the house cools down over night. Only bad thing.... the light on the front is REALLY bright. My room is normally dark and this little thing lights up the whole room! I am going to put some duct tape over it as there’s no way to dim it. That’s the only downside.
customer_reviews.author: Albajo

customer_reviews.title: Sounds Like Galloping Horses
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this fan for about 2 hours and it has already developed an extremely loud “clicking” noise when it’s rotating. It literally sounds like galloping horses. I don’t know why it would be called the quiet set when it makes the same sound as hooves slamming against a cobblestone road. It’s not even a full tower fan! It’s just one tiny little fan in a tall case that could easily fit two of the tiny fans.
customer_reviews.author: D.Chap

customer_reviews.title: This is not a quiet fan.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if I have a defective product, but this has a sound on top of the air moving, kind of a high whirring like some part inside the 80mm fan has friction. Some people seem disappointed in the design of the fan as well, but it puts out enough air for a personal fan in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan G.

customer_reviews.title: It's INCREDIBLY loud! Super depressing :(
customer_reviews.text: It's the loudest fan I've ever had the non-pleasure of owning. I bought it because it was advertised as extremely quiet but unfortunately those were just words to sell a product. Even on its lowest setting it's very loud. It's second setting is twice as loud. And it's highest setting is basically a jet engine b
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This little guy is great!
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure what other people were saying when they mentioned that it doesn't blow a lot of air or isn't very strong. I keep this fan on its lowest setting, and I think it's wonderful! It's very quiet and calming. The amount of air is perfect for its purpose as a desk fan. I also really enjoy the oscillation more than I than I thought I would. Its footprint is very small. I think it looks really nice. I would honestly say this is the best pick for a desk fan. Absolutely no complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Jon-Michael

customer_reviews.title: finally
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a bedside fan that I can actually feel and not be so loud. This worked out perfectly. I love the different settings and this little guy gives out power. As far as noise goes, it sounds like white noise and that's on the loudest setting. Loved it so much, I bought a second one. Makes my hot flashes so much more bearable.
customer_reviews.author: Charles N.

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: I am a light sleeper and the sound of a regular fan is annoying to me. This little guy is perfect. I put it on my nightstand and use the "sleep" mode and Oscillating mode. It is very quiet and feels like a breeze coming thru my window. The light on the LED dims once the fan starts so there is not a problem with "blue light". I like it so much that I bought a second to put on my other night stand so now I am surrounded with a "gentle breeze" when I go to sleep. This will not cool a large room...but works just fine from 2-3 feet away.
customer_reviews.author: N. Osso

customer_reviews.title: Personal Size Fan
customer_reviews.text: Nice buy if you want a small kinda quiet multiple setting air fan. It's a little over 12in tall. Tall not bulky. It blows out enough air to feel it but in a small room like bedroom and it only hits about 3 feet wide. Good to cool minimally. Don't expect full forced air. Not this little guy!
customer_reviews.author: R. Gamboa

customer_reviews.title: Barely blows air out and loud motor.  Garbage.  Returning.
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't blow much air at all to be noticeable. You have to be arms length to feel the air in a quieter nose setting. It BARELY blows air on the sleep setting and it's not that quiet with the motor. On highest setting is very loud for the amount of air it pushes out. Love the sleep timer, but that's about it. Not as advertised, I'm not sure why the rave reviews. Spend more and get a fan that actually blows air and has a better motor. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: by Justine

customer_reviews.title: Very noisy. Weak air flow.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these for desk fans and returned them as soon as I tested one. Extremely noisy and much larger than they need to be for the small diameter fan contained inside the tower. They move very little air even on the highest/noisiest setting. There are much quieter and compact fans for the same or cheaper price that do the same job. All the extras on this fan, sleep timer, oscillate and white noise are just unnecessary on such an underpowered fan.
customer_reviews.author: Dupe Dilligaf

customer_reviews.title: EXACTLY WHAT WE NEEDED!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I are both gamers. So two desks, side by side with computers constantly running, it's going to warm up the room a bit. We bought this fan and placed it between our desks and it definitely reaches the both of us and makes a huge difference. It has amazing features like circulating movement and POWER COOL, which is exactly what we needed! Thank you Amazon and Honeywell for this amazing product!!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki Chaneco

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: The design is a misrepresentation of what it is. I thought there was a blower motor inside pushing the air since it was an upright. Come to find out that the product has a cpu class fan pushing the air in the middle. I have to have the setting at “white noise” to feel it from 3 feet away. You can definitely hear it running but it does not bother me. For what it is, I think the price point is high at $20.
customer_reviews.author: Boxster

customer_reviews.title: It's Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I am a fan of this fan. I love the size, I love that it doesn't feel like a hurricane is blowing in my face and I love that it's quiet. I purchased it when the dreaded hot flashes started and I would wake up in the middle of the night and walk around to cool down. Now I have it on my night stand and when the episodes happen, I just pull the covers off and let the fan cool me down. I'm getting a whole lot more sleep these days, thanks to this wonderful fan.
customer_reviews.author: C. Alea

customer_reviews.title: Powerful little fan
customer_reviews.text: I got 2 of these for my husband and I for when we go to sleep at night, fit perfectly on our end tables and don't take up too much space. I love that about them, also they have numerous fan settings. The only thing I don't like about these fans, the plug is an AC adapter plug. When you put it into the back of the fan, sometimes it doesn't work. I really wish that they just made the cord connected, don't really get the point of the adapter...
customer_reviews.author: Mecebra

customer_reviews.title: Table fan that vibrates right off of the table
customer_reviews.text: Seller did nothing wrong .... but.... Literally used the fan for one day . I placed the fan in the center of a little table , turned it on and went away for a couple hours , went back to the room with the fan and it had vibrated so much it actually moved and fell onto the floor , breaking the fan & making it make even worse noises . It was already too loud on high for my liking , now it sounds like something caught in the spokes of a bike . Plus , didn't have enough power on lower speeds to make a difference . Not good for me , may be good for you .
customer_reviews.author: Anjuli

customer_reviews.title: Cleaning fan is difficult. Solution is gauze pad
customer_reviews.text: This fan provides average satisfaction but, cleaning this fan is extremely difficult ... for example, the top screws are three slotted, not a Philips head, not a Torqs ... Who sells a screwdriver that looks like a peace sign? KAZ should sell a pre-filter holder to attach to the intake side of the fan and a replaceable filter element fitted to the holder. This element should last for a month of use. Hopefully, it will be added to an upgraded model. To make a replaceable filter, open a large gauze pad, separate the coarse cloth for use as the fan's filter and tape it on the back.
customer_reviews.author: Customer1234

customer_reviews.title: The Best Fan for your Bedroom
customer_reviews.text: I was using this fan for the guest room, but tried it in my own bedroom and love it so much, I bought another one to replace the guest room fan! The four functions (sleep, white noise, cool and refresh) are perfect especially if you live in a very quiet area and can't sleep because there's no noise! I highly recommend this fan, especially for the quality and ease in using. You won't be disappointed if you buy one. Sleep well or just refresh your room!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Powerful Desk Tower Fan
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my desk. I thought it would be a nice but cheap little fan. HAH! This is the best desk fan I have EVER bought. It has four settings and the highest setting will help even a 50 year old woman having a hot flash! (and I should know lol) The buttons are so easy to understand I didn't even need to read the directions this time around. For the price you cannot beat this powerful little tower fan. If you buy some of the charcoal rolls that normally go in an air cleaner and attach it to the back...you will also now have an air cleaner for your desk. :0)
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Not a strong breeze, but it has its uses
customer_reviews.text: even when on the highest speed, u will start to feel the air fade away if youre 5-6ft away from it. For this fan to work, it should be located exactly how u see it in the pictures. Very close/No more than 6 feet away from you. Also, like most fans, your room needs to be at a decent temp (lower than 79, from my pov) in order to get a cooler breeze. ANY NON A/C FAN being used in a hot and humid room will make your body hotter more than anything else.
customer_reviews.author: SLT

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for work desk
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to sit on my desk in my home office rather than resorting to bumping the A/C on to get air movement (since working from home full time due to the pandemic). This is perfect. "Sleep" & "White Noise" modes gives a nice breeze and is quiet enough (sitting right next to me on the desk) to not disrupt video/conference calls. When not on a call, the higher speeds, "Refresh" & "Power Cool" are great and still not disruptively loud (so I can still hear my background music without increasing the volume).
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Bad Buy
customer_reviews.text: Thousands of these reviews have to be fake. This isn't really a tower fan. It's a fan, in a fake tower. The louvers above and below the circular fan are faux. It's literally a computer fan in a large casing that looks like a tower fan. The power cool setting is pretty loud, but it's good white noise if you can set it 15+ feet away.
customer_reviews.author: Juston

customer_reviews.title: Good desk fan
customer_reviews.text: This is a good desk fan. Just keep your expectations in check. This fan doesn't push a ton of air, but if placed on your desktop and a few feet away from you, it does an good job. (I would guess that this is what it was designed to do.) The lowest setting is really quiet, and pushes enough air to cool you off. The Highest setting pushes a good amount of air, but starts to get a bit noisy. I keep it on low and it cools me off just fine. It's stylish and doesn't take up a ton of room. It sort of disappears on my desk. I'd buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Reilly

customer_reviews.title: Low Air Flow
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a bad fan, however it just feels low on power of air flow. It is nice and quiet though. I have it on a corner table pushed off to the corner of my daughter's bunk bed in case she needs extra air flow on the bottom bunk. Luckily, I decided to get this fan plus another. We use the other one to keep her cool, and this one we'll use for little friends who come over for sleepovers who might need just a little extra air flow too.
customer_reviews.author: Rollerderby Lover

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: My mom has this fan in her bathroom, as it can get hot in there. I originally bought this for my bedroom, as my window faces the sun when it rises and it would get extremely hot in here. I have since moved this to my bathroom and it has been a godsend. The bathroom gets very warm from either showers or just general warm Florida temps and doing your makeup or hair in there can be such a burden. This fan blows cool air on you as you're doing whatever you're doing in there and makes up for the lack of a/c in there.
customer_reviews.author: Nimira

customer_reviews.title: Too small to do any good unless you're a squirrel.
customer_reviews.text: This item redefines the term "personal" as it pertains to fans. Yes, it has all the features advertised, but the thing is literally a CPU cooling fan. So, when you put a (I'm being generous) 2" fan in the middle of a 13" tower, it doesn't matter how much power you push to the thing, the only body part you’re cooling off is one of your eyebrows. Nice try guys, but definitely not an AZ heat mitigation plan.
customer_reviews.author: Marc

customer_reviews.title: Don’t listen to the bad reviews (getting bad rap
customer_reviews.text: I just got this fan yesterday and LOVE it. Gentile air flow for sleep mode and adjustable if you want more air. It is very quiet in sleep mode. I just don’t understand the poor reviews, you don’t want a blast of air blowing on you when sleeping but if you do buy a BIG fan. It has four settings, sleep,white noise,refresh and power cool and also oscilltates . As I say I love it and it is just what I want and need an almost didn’t order it due to the reviews. Again don’t listen to the reviews. I bought it thinking probably will send it back. But no chance of that, it’s a keeper.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Carraher

customer_reviews.title: this little fan is great for table tops and desks
customer_reviews.text: this little fan is great for table tops and desks. Doesn't push a ton of air so don't expect it to cool down a whole room but if you need white noise in the background while sleeping this is perfect. It does push out great air for a bedside as well. Plan on buying another one for my desk at work.
customer_reviews.author: Jazzinelly

customer_reviews.title: great little fan
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this fan to provide air movement around plant cuttings I was rooting and it has worked great for 3 months now. There are a lot of things to love about this fan: 3 different timer settings, oscillating option, different fan speeds. It was exactly what I was looking for. I can set the fan speed according to whether I just watered and set the timer so I don't have to remember to shut it off at the end of the day. Would definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME PURCHASE!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect office desk fan. This unit was very quiet. Long cord. Very easy instructions and simple to operate. Light weight. And above all, very very cool breeze.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer diaz

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy. It's weak, noisy and ratio benefit / cost low
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed with Honeywell, they are really a great brand insofar as fans are concerned, but with this one they failed. The fan claims to be "silent" for a "desk", they even claim that has low consumption because of being a direct current motor? I want to think that the marketing person didn't know what was talking about. So, the motor is so small that in order to give you some air, needs to work at its fullest and, it's noisier than the regular fans they have. So, we returned it after 24 hs. Get the regular honeywells, this model is crap.
customer_reviews.author: S100

customer_reviews.title: Room inside for two fans but only has one.
customer_reviews.text: This "fan" is just a tall plastic tower made to look like a tower fan, some (rather nice) controls on the base and a standard small computer fan inside. There appears to be plenty of room to have 2 such fans stacked one above the other, but instead the one fan is about in the middle of the tower. It blows okay, with decent sound level, but it could have been so much more with just a second computer fan to use the entire height of the grill.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I expected this to really put out some air but it doesn't, not even on the Power Cool. It is not as quiet as mentioned in the description. I kept it only because of the pain of returning and not happy with it. This fan sits right next to my bed and can barely feel it. Was hoping this was a bladeless fan, since it was not mentioned anywhere in their description, that there is only one tiny little 3 blade fan inside. Not worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: DIANA

customer_reviews.title: The best fan ever!
customer_reviews.text: I never thought I would be a fan of a fan lmao but I am! I am obsessed with this one. It is the best. You can put it right next to you m. On your nightstand. Which I do. Or on a desk. It’s a cute little tower. It’s whisper Silent so I leave on all nighT. Or you can crank it up. It barely takes up any space. Perfect for home, office, small apartment. I’m even going to get a second one for the kitchen! So worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Bolden

customer_reviews.title: Really like this fan.
customer_reviews.text: I really like this mini-version of my tower fan. Only thing I don't like is that the blue light can't be dimmed off. Being used on a night-stand, this should be a standard feature, as it is on the tower fan.
customer_reviews.author: Mormor

customer_reviews.title: Love the small size and the timer function
customer_reviews.text: I bought this specifically for the compact size and the timer function. I replaced a similar desk fan that I always forgot to turn off so the timer function on this one is awesome. Set it for 8 hours and forget about it and I know it'll turn off by the time I'm done working. Good air flow, pretty quiet. The highest setting is a little loud but not a deal breaker. I would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Crazy Cat Guy

customer_reviews.title: computer fan
customer_reviews.text: This item is ok not as power full as I was hoping for it’s basically a computer fan in a tower that can swing back and forth, I can’t really recommend this to anyone, way over priced and payed for what it is
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: Perfect personal fan!
customer_reviews.text: This fan is fabulous. It has a timer and 4 modes of flow strength. It is pretty darn quiet and feels great! Highly recommended. If you are needing a large volume fan, this isn't your fan, but if you just need a small area cooled off and maybe just some air circulation, this is perfect! I love a fan blowing in my face at night and this was perfect!
customer_reviews.author: tondra78

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and Cool
customer_reviews.text: I love this Honeywell Fan mostly for its quietness. The three intensity levels, the quietness, and the timer capabilities are all very attractive features for a fan. Although, the fan itself is not very strong, that’s the trade off for having a fan that’s this quiet. It’s just like a “cool breeze” that provides just enough coolness to ward off the summer heat.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says...
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this little fan. It does what it says. I’m using it now. It’s on cool mode now. White noise section will also help me sleep. Timer is awesome. The tall thin design doesn’t take up much room. There’s some noise but not to the point it’s too distracting to help you sleep or just watch tv. This by far the best fan I had bought and tried over the summer. It’s also nice that the cord is long and no expensive batteries or usb cord needed. Ten stars if there’s such a thing. Also it came a day earlier than expected Thank you. This is already cooling me down. Worth the purchase
customer_reviews.author: dreamy

customer_reviews.title: It's okay but don't expect much
customer_reviews.text: It's a fairly quiet fan but it's small so the amount of air it moves is pretty small even at high settings. Despite having a "tall" design, it really only blows air in a narrow channel through the center so it doesn't do a very good job of distributing the air flow. As an added result, it has no vertical air flow which means that if you put this on your desk, none of the air will ever reach your face (unless you have your face on your desk). The minimum sleep duration is also 2 hours, which is way too long for a sleep function .
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: It's a fan...
customer_reviews.text: It's a desk fan. It's nothing fancy. You sit in close proximity to it, and it gets the job done. Apparently, Amazon is full of desk fan aficionados. It's a fan. It blows cool air. If you want something that will turn your workspace into the arctic, this isn't it. It will keep you comfortable enough. No regrets in purchasing it.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Dahlstedt

customer_reviews.title: Silly design for a round computer case fan
customer_reviews.text: This looks like a tower fan, but it's not. It's a standard computer case fan inside a tall plastic tower. The only part of the fins that blows out is a few inches in the middle. The top 2 inches and 2 inches of the fan fins you see on the tower? They do nothing. It's blocked off behind the fins. Fake. This fan is 4 inches taller than it needs to be, the excess height taken up by fake plastic to make the fan look more impressive.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: The blue light is the worst feature
customer_reviews.text: This would be a great DESK fan! Very lightweight and kind of cool that it oscillates. However as a bed side fan the only setting that I can actually feel is the full power setting. The blue light is SO, SO, bright that I have to wrap a towel around the bottom to cover it up otherwise it’s stinging right in my eyes. Also it’s kind of hard to push the buttons with only one hand. The fan is so lightweight that if you try to push them with one hand it scoots all the way across the table. Like I said, it would make a great fan for a desk or cubicle
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Kidd

customer_reviews.title: Horrible fan and dangerous
customer_reviews.text: Worst fan ever. Doesn’t have any output on the highest setting. If your face isn’t right in front of it, you can’t feel anything. They took a teeny tiny fan and put in a huge encasement! You’re better off buying a tiny wire fan for $5! This thing is absolutely garbage! Oh and mine literally burnt out after 2 months. It smelled like burning in my room for days because of this. Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: Lauralee

customer_reviews.title: Cheap circular fan hidden in a tower body
customer_reviews.text: We have several full-size tower fans and love them. When I saw this fan from Honeywell that was about half-height, I put it in my cart right away. It's not anywhere close to what it appears to be. It's a small, cheap circular fan hidden in a tower body. And, it has all the power of a butterfly when it comes to moving air. I didn't scrutinize too much since it was a Honeywell product. Well, either someone is pretending to be Honeywell or they've sold out. Pass on this fan.
customer_reviews.author: Kirt Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great room fan
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my room, ceiling fan broke, and it has worked great. I love that it's super portable and can move to another room if needed. Has great airflow and have used it these hot summer nights in sleep mode when the house just does not cool off. When I work out and I need lots of cooling I turn it up and it does the trick!
customer_reviews.author: FourPawsFanatic

customer_reviews.title: This Is not a real "tower fan" and only has a weak 12v round fan in it like a computer cooling fan that blows little air
customer_reviews.text: The appearance of being a tower fan is deceiving. The only fan in this is a small round low voltage fan like you would find in a computer. Even at high speed you have to hold it right in front of your face to feel a breeze. When opening the box seeing a low voltage transformer and plug was a clue about bad things to come. The ad does say "low voltage" which it is because it has no wind power.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing, not a true desktop tower fan
customer_reviews.text: This truly is a 2.5 inch computer fan right in the center of the tower. The five inches of plastic above the actual fan is show and wasted space/plastic. It does not put out any air unless on highest setting. The "white noise" feature is 1) still the fan on second to lowest setting (thought it meant true white noise without blowing air) and 2) doesn't make any white noise at that low setting. Disappointing and returning this item at this time. The description of this fan is not accurate.
customer_reviews.author: KJsPurchases

customer_reviews.title: Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: We bought this fan and it completely stopped working 2 months later. Of course, we are no longer able to return it. DO NOT BUY THIS! Waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: ashley

customer_reviews.title: I love this fan but this one came without a cord!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan at Target and I love it. It can oscillate and there are different speeds. It is noisy and that is what I like about it. I sleep with it on for white noise. I also travel with it and use it in hotels to further drown out the noise. This one from here that I ordered didn't have a power cord! Thankfully the fan I had that was on its last legs, the plug was good and I used that one.
customer_reviews.author: E Gonso

customer_reviews.title: Very Weak - Great if you're trying to cool a baby mouse, otherwise don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a desk fan to provide a little additional cooling for my home office. However, the fan is so weak that even on the "power cool" setting (which is a complete misnomer) you can barely feel it blowing, even when it's less than a foot away. What a complete letdown! If you want a fan that works as a paperweight, and looks nice, go for it. But, if you want a fan that actually blows, and provides a decent amount of cooling, then skip this one.
customer_reviews.author: S. Barrus

customer_reviews.title: If you want a night light that doubles as a fan
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my bedroom to run while sleeping. The controls are so bright it was like sleeping with a neon sign in my room. There should have been some way to turn the light off or at least down. Way too bright. Fan provided minimal air comfort. Must be directly in front of to feel air. More than three feet away and it is pointless.
customer_reviews.author: Williams

customer_reviews.title: Less than a year old and it no longer oscillates
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan less than a year ago and used it a handful of times last summer. This summer it already stopped oscillating and the cost of sending it in for warranty repairs is $10 already – not worth paying for since the fan itself isn't worth a ton. When it worked properly I didn't have any complaints, it worked fine. Sadly the quality wasn't great in terms of longevity.
customer_reviews.author: Prisca Lo Surdo

customer_reviews.title: Decent bed side fan for light sleepers
customer_reviews.text: Has multiple settings for speeds as well as a timer mode and rotation as well. Would be really good for light sleepers as it can be quite quiet. My only problem with the fan is on hits highest setting it does get pretty loud but barely pushes any air. I'm more of a heavy sleeper so I felt like I could have used a bit more power on the highest setting as I like a decent amount of air blowing on me. Overall really good fan for people that just want light air movement while they sleep!
customer_reviews.author: Castaway

customer_reviews.title: HAPPY!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my desk at work. My coworker always gets cold and the a/c unit in our office is noisy, but it gets warm at my desk when the sun is shining. This unit arrived in 2 days and is so quiet! Quiet mode cools my space just enough to be comfortable. Don't even need the stronger setting. Can't beat the price! So happy I got it 😃!!!
customer_reviews.author: Kate's mom

customer_reviews.title: Blows like a champ
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. I originally bought it because we were going to my in-laws house who’s AC wasn’t working (in Texas). I set this puppy right next to our bed on full blast and slept like a baby! (As did our baby). Now I leave it running all the time next to our bed at home on sleep mode just for that “refreshed” feel at night. It’s awesome
customer_reviews.author: Brandi

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a couple of these for our plants to help with air circulation, it’s very quiet and fits almost anywhere. It’s very user friendly, I especially like the timer option so I can have it running while our plant lights are on
customer_reviews.author: KG

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Not effective. The large grill it has is misleading. The fan inside is quite small and is, in fact a cpu fan for a computer. This units large grill is for nothing. It's not very quiet compared to other fans either. I was looking for a better style fan and this one just doesn't cut it.
customer_reviews.author: TF

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: OMG!!!!! I love love love this fan. I get really hot at night so this is perfect for me. I wish it was one my inch taller it would be perfect. It fixes perfectly for my dresser. I love the fact it rotates. I wish the light in front dims at night. I would buy another one. I would recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: tisha

customer_reviews.title: Wish it blew air from the whole fan
customer_reviews.text: I order it for my grandma when I got it I opened it up to see how it worked it worked ok on thing is I thought the air was gonna come out of the whole fan but it’s more just for looks (the standing rectangle) the fan part is only a small circle in the middle of the rectangle
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Jae

customer_reviews.title: Great product simple as that
customer_reviews.text: I like that it was cheaper than the original one and worked just the same. I have a friend that has the same exact one and she got it brand new and I can’t tell the difference between the two fans anymore. It’s very quiet even on the highest setting. I love that it also has an oscillating setting in order to deliver the air around the room evenly. It’s great for small places, especially on someone’s desk at work or something like that. I would not recommend it to cool down a whole entire room, I tried to do that this summer in Texas and it was not successful.
customer_reviews.author: Ayana

customer_reviews.title: Great item!
customer_reviews.text: This is our 2nd purchase of this item. Bought one 3 years ago for our eldest daughters dorm. It worked so well we bought a 2nd for our other daughters dorm!
customer_reviews.author: Rick Hettinger

customer_reviews.title: Not that quiet
customer_reviews.text: This fan is NOT very quiet, unlike how it’s advertised. Its mechanical whir is louder than all other fans I have bought that did not advertise being quiet. I bought this fan to go on my nightstand to cool me off as I sleep but the lights on it were very bright. I put some electrical tape on the lights and, on it’s lowest setting, it provides some cooling relief at night for a tolerable noise level.
customer_reviews.author: Abigail Radford

customer_reviews.title: Replacement Fan works great
customer_reviews.text: The initial shipment had a fan that was cycling through the various speeds on its own.. so it would go from low to high and continuously repeat the cycle.. no other issues.. We received a replacement and are very happy with it.. small footprint for desk, reasonable circulation.. The timer, fan speeds and oscillation are good.. operation is pretty quiet except on Power Cool level..
customer_reviews.author: JChill

customer_reviews.title: SO Grateful I found this fan!
customer_reviews.text: This fan is a perfect size, style and easy to operate. I have a VERY hard time getting to sleep and I live in a noisy place. I love that the fan doesn't add more noise, it blends enough but never annoying. I honestly feel this is the nicest fan EVER! My only tiny thing that would be very nice addition would be a remote, (it would be worth the extra money too). I still love it so much, I almost never have it off so really fine without the remote. Thank you for making this fan and for having it on Amazon. I will probably get another so I am never without.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa W.

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Considering the reviews, I thought this product was going to be bad, but I decided to give it a try anyways. It works great if you put it in your nightstand ir office table. The product is great and the price too.
customer_reviews.author: PR

customer_reviews.title: Its' fine. A decent fan, quiet, does what its supposed to
customer_reviews.text: It's just a regular round fan set in the middle of the 'tower' not a real tower fan with air coming out across its entire height. The rotation is nice, since it doesn't cut a wide arc like other designs. The different settings are nice, and the auto-off timer function is nice to have.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Owens

customer_reviews.title: extremely underpowered can barely feel anything
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly underpowered in power cool mode you barely can feel any cooling from an inch away in sleep mode it was like nothing I ended up trying to sleep with it on my chest join the tiniest little bit of Breeze but it was completely useless just about any fan is more powerful than this in fact I can later later in front of it on any mood but the highest I gave you the timer and noise level a better rating just because I never used the timer at all and the noise level was kind of quiet because there was a basically useless incredibly weak fan. 12 hours after getting it I'm returning it
customer_reviews.author: Pete G.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Fan!!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this before reading reviews. I was bored one day and I read the reviews and got extremely worried. When it arrived I unpacked it very carefully. To my suprise this fan it absolutely amazing. Yes, it does not blow that much air (as it is small) but you should know that before purchasing. A small fan is not going to blow a lot of air. As for the noise, mine is completely silent. All you can hear is the blowing noise. Some reviews said it had a ticking or burrddd sound, but mine does not do that. I highly recommend this fan if you have a small area and need it to be cooler. It works fantastically!!
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Desk Fan!
customer_reviews.text: This is actually a super cute looking fan. I have a pretty small room so I was trying to be cheap and get a little fan, just to give me some extra air flow but this was not the case. You have to be super close to the fan to feel the air, even on high it’s not very powerful and it’s not the quietest thing. It would be perfect for a desk when you’re sitting right in front of it.
customer_reviews.author: Summer C.

customer_reviews.title: Nice little personal fan
customer_reviews.text: Nice little fan for the price. Worked a whole lot better than the other fans I had purchased from Amazon. Small profile, the oscillation works well, love the different speeds/settings. Honeywell is a name I trust.
customer_reviews.author: Bethany Dale

customer_reviews.title: Timer function, wait, what!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have three of these and only ordered the third from Amazon. I don't recall ever seeing a timer function but, that's okay obviously because, I love this little guy! One at bedside, vanity, and at desk! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: PeenoPooh

customer_reviews.title: Quiet and convenient!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot explain how much I love this little fan! I was hot in my office and we can't change the thermostats. I was looking for something small and quiet that could sit on my desk, and this is the perfect solution. It is quiet, has 4 different settings and allows you to set a timer or make it oscillate. I would buy this fan ten more times if I had to. I have been using it for a few months now and have had not trouble with it at all. It is extremely easy to use. I love that I can change the setting based on how hot or cold I am. Would definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Lucio

customer_reviews.title: cools my 10x10 office
customer_reviews.text: I get no air flow in my office. NONE. I needed a fan that would provide air flow AND cool the office a bit. I have the larger Honeywell quiet set, so thought this would work well for my small space. And it does! I have it on a shelf in the back of the office, and the rotate function means that air is flowing steadily, keeping the room from being so stuffy. An excellent product for a small space.
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fan for your work desk
customer_reviews.text: This fan is perfect for use at your desk! Or as I do, use for in the bathroom when getting ready for work! It is lightweight, quiet and just the right size to use for when you need air to cool you off.
customer_reviews.author: relm

customer_reviews.title: Product failed after 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: I liked this fan at first but unfortunately it randomly changes speeds without hitting the button. In order to get replaced under warranty Honeywell requires you ship the fan to them at your own expense. Unfortunately the fan isn't worth the cost of shipping it. Do no buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Obrigewitsch

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive Little Fan
customer_reviews.text: This is an ok fan for a kid. The main disappointment is the actual fan area. It only covers about 3 1/2 inches in diameter in the center of the fan itself. There's a small hole cut out but you dont realize it until it's in your hands. The rest of the surface are is blocked! Not worth the price even with the timer function.
customer_reviews.author: Tre

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Fan!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to replace an older fan of similar size. This one is smaller, quieter, lighter and has more features. It can sit quietly on the counter and move a lot of air all day while you pretty much forget its there. Great little fan - get one for yourself and another for your friends.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Angelo

customer_reviews.title: Please do not purchase unless you hate fans that actually work.
customer_reviews.text: Absolute waste of money. I purchase fans for their ability to move air. End of story. This fan does that VERY poorly. The case looks great, the buttons look great, it even oscillates. This fan does EVERYTHING you could ever hope for in a small desk fan except for actually fanning air. No exaggeration- it is literally a PC fan in an oversized case. The fact that the grill is so large is only to effectively misrepresent the size and power of the tiny fan. Well played, well played indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Extremely weak air circulation power
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small fan to sit on a dresser in my small 9x9 room, which proved too large for this fan. I wanted to use it to circulate air and keep the room consistently cool throughout the night without having to keep the AC continuously running. On the highest mode, you could only feel the air if you were within 2 feet. If you put it on any other mode, the air movement was barely detectable. It is remarkably quiet as the description says, but in my opinion would only be valuable if you’re looking for a fan you can leave on your desk, facing you. Any further away and this product won’t be effective.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Good table top fan
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little fan. I have really bad hot flashes , so it blows air perfectly on my face. To me it is on the quiet side . You can hear it, but it's not that loud. Actually the noise level puts me to sleep. The wire itself is very thin, it broke on me, so be careful with it. I was able to fix it with electrical tape.
customer_reviews.author: peppercorn

customer_reviews.title: Great bedside fan.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this fan to use on my nightstand during the summer. I don't have a lot of room so a regular sized table top fan doesn't fit. This fan is the perfect size. I love the four airflow options and the timer options. The only thing I don't like about this fan (and the reason I didn't give it five stars) is that the blue light is BRIGHT. When I had the fan on the highest setting the bright blue light would literally light up my bedroom. I had to cover up the blue light so I could get some sleep. Other than that, this is a wonderful fan.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: It is louder than expected (as many reviews state), but for the price I can't complain. Was just looking for a small fan for on my desk and this does the job. Probably wouldn't want it on if I was on a conference call though due to the noise level.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonMom

customer_reviews.title: Small Fan
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I thought was going to be. Great for small spaces. Air output is only so so.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fan time!
customer_reviews.text: The timer feature on this is great! Like other reviews, it’s basically a large computer fan. I like the 4 different speeds and that it rotates. The lights that display which speed you’re on are on the whole time the fan is on which may be too bright for people who like absence of light during sleep. I taped over mine. Also the noise the fan produces is more midrange to high frequencies and doesn’t produce the soothing lows of a large fan blade. For the price and fan vs no fan, I think it’s a nice addition for deeper sleep.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Save yourselves!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst fan you will ever buy! Please! Save yourselves and don’t buy this piece of crap fan!!! It is a little tiny fan inside of a big plastic veneer that looks modern. I found myself today having to crouch into the fan to feel it, and it is sitting a foot away from me. I am going to return this tomorrow as soon as I can!!
customer_reviews.author: Karmen

customer_reviews.title: Wide oscillation. Very quiet.
customer_reviews.text: Great for my desk. The only thing I dislike about it is not being able to adjust whether the air flows up or down but that's really a minor feature. It definitely sounds like a fan when it's on the "power cool" mode but the "sleep" and "white noise" modes are impressively quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie

customer_reviews.title: living in the moment
customer_reviews.text: Had this fan for some time now. So quiet and the modes work well. So I bought a second one for my office. So much better and quieter than the old one. Will buy again when I need another.
customer_reviews.author: Livin' in the Moment

customer_reviews.title: This thing hardly blowes
customer_reviews.text: This fan hardly blows air. If you have your face right in it you can feel it but that's it
customer_reviews.author: Sky

customer_reviews.title: Can't sleep with it in the room
customer_reviews.text: The fan works well and is reasonably quiet, but it has a **Big Blue Light** which is very disruptive if it's in your bedroom at night. I had to tape cardboard over it in order to sleep. Google Harvard Health about blue lights in the bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Linda P.

customer_reviews.title: Ended up Returning this fan
customer_reviews.text: I have a portable fan a fraction of the size of this one and the smaller fan is much more powerful than this larger one. Usually, I like honeywell products, but the company really gave up on the performance of this product. It is more stylish than practical. If you want a small fan to cool you down in your office or room, keep looking. This fan is not it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Chinea

product_meta.title: Honeywell HTF210B Quiet Set Personal Table Fan
product_meta.description: Design:FanThe Honeywell QuietSet Mini Tower Table Fan is a slim and compact model that's ideal for cooling small areas of personal space. The aspects of comfort and convenience can be observed with the inclusion of Advanced QuietSet Control that allows owners to personalize sound and cooling power. An easy touch display and 2 8 hour auto off timer have also been incorporated for increased ease of use. This table fan also carries the additional bonus of saving you up to 50 percent energy as opposed to AC motors. The slim design of the Honeywell QuietSet Mini Tower Table Fan makes it a natural addition for desktops, nightstands and other areas of personal space.
feature_bullets: Quiet cooling: Honeywell’s QuietSet Line of Fans Are Quiet & Powerful, So You’ll Feel the Fan’s Cooling Power With Less Sound.

Increase your comfort: Using fans for air circulation in your home can help Increase your comfort, and help reduce energy costs as well. Honeywell carries a range of tower fans, floor fans, and oscillating fans -- find one for every room in the house.

Honeywell fans: The right fan helps cool you off & improves airflow in your room or home. Give your air conditioner & wallet a break by using fans to help reduce your energy consumption & costs. Honeywell carries a variety of fans to meet your home needs.
Honeywell quality: Help Improve Air Circulation & Energy Savings in Your Home, Bedroom or Office With Honeywell Fans.

Oscillating table fan: The Honeywell Quietset 13-inch table fan provides personal cooling with quiet operation, oscillation, & an automatic shut-off timer. 4 levels of sound & power settings, lets you choose the level that’s best for your cooling needs.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars6,327 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
